channel.title: XP and W7 in a workgroup
channel.description:
I have an XP and W7 computer which are in the same workgroup. I could shared files and folder from W7 just fine on XP. Then suddenly I couldn't. Nothing was changed.
Wtf do I do?

item.title: XP and W7 in a workgroup
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
I’ve tried reapplying the workgroup, which is basically the same thing. I don’t see how I can reset the network settings other than changing them and then changing them back, or something.

Read full topic
item.source: XP and W7 in a workgroup

item.title: XP and W7 in a workgroup
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
Have you tried completely deleting your work group, resetting your network settings, and then trying to set it all up again from scratch?

Read full topic

item.title: XP and W7 in a workgroup
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
meh, the monitor doesn’t really bother me, i barely use it anyway, since that computer is hooked to my TV… i only use the monitor to browse to the movie files, really

the workgroup thingy is still not working though

edit: i just noticed about half the words are missing in my previous posts

item.title: XP and W7 in a workgroup
item.dc:creator: Mango_Assassin
item.description:
Burbinator:

I punched my XP monitor. Now there’s a big white line on it.

Yea… can’t help you with that one bro lol.

well done tho burb. a new 23inch led monitor will do nicely.

Your good at creating problems arent you.

Read full topic
item.source: XP and W7 in a workgroup

item.title: XP and W7 in a workgroup
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
It’s fucking shit isn’t it. It hasn’t been working for a few days now though. The options are all correct, and I disabled the firewall (I only the Windows one). Still no luck. I’ll try changing the workgroup name.

I raged so much a few days ago that I punched my XP monitor. Now there’s a big white line on it.

Read full topic
item.source: XP and W7 in a workgroup

item.title: XP and W7 in a workgroup
item.dc:creator: Cameron_D
item.description:
Mine does this all the time. Works one day, doesn’t the next.
Check your W7 sharing options, sisable passworded sharing, try change the name of the workgroup, chack your firewall (And the windows firewall. I found the W7 has a secondary firewall of sorts that doesn’t disable when you disable the firewall >_>)

Read full topic
item.source: XP and W7 in a workgroup
